ratings.comment: Not interested in teaching. His time is more valuable than anyone else.

Highly disorganized. Did not grade or give any feedback on labs until the week before finals & no response to repeated emails.  Changed day and time of lab on 5 times with notice as short as 3 days, which created conflicts w/ other classes. Good lecturer but a gamble with grades and not learning from your mistakes b/c no feedback & lacks empathy.

The lab Towles conducts is thought-provoking and provides valuable learning experiences, although they necessitate a considerable amount of independent work. This level of autonomy can be advantageous as it encourages self-reliance and problem-solving skills, yet it may also be challenging for some students who require more guidance and support.

Towles' was disorganized. The pacing was slow and then rushed right before finals. His lecture slides were uniformative. During class, he focused on specific examples and work with classmates instead of actually lecturing. Sometime he would simply give us his written derivations and tell us to read through them ourselves.

Towels office hours were the most helpful resource in this class. He will readily explain/demo/draw to present the information in different ways until you understand the concept. He's willing to help guide your thought process on tricky homework problems or lab questions, as long as you're willing to put in the time and ask.

Towles is hands down my favorite professor. Not because of how I did in his class or because he makes the content tractable, but because he is simply a talented lecturer. He knows exactly how to structure such a wide range of knowledge into a digestable and interesting manner. He truly cares how well his students do, he's there to help you succeed.

If you understand Mechanics of Materials well, you'll do great. That was the hardest segment of the class in my opinion, and it was the most prevalent on exams. Also, the homework is hard an can take a while. I'd recommend taking Matlab (CS310) before taking this class because the lab reports take f each week if you are not fluent in it.
He understands that this is just meant to be an introductory class. Covers all the basics and explains relevant information well.

This was Joseph Towles' first semester as a professor for Biomechanics. There were times when he would mess up in class either with equations or some concepts, but overall he is a very good lecturer. His office hours are always helpful, and the labs are fun. Exams graded fairly, you can get up to 50% of points lost from the 1st time taking an exam!
